column2: Which i am having mixed feelings about.

column3: Chipotle is a great place to work...........if you’re 17.

column2: If you’re new to the working world and haven’t had any experience with truly shitty and soul crushing human garbage bags (aka customers)
column3: then you’re ready to work there.
have been working in the retail industry for 10 years
column4: have cried (often) because you feel like scrubbing human urine and feces off the floor is what you’re worth has been reduced to
column5: or don’t feel like being patronized by snooty teenagers who think they’re gods gift to the world because they work at chipotle
column7: this work is not for you.

column2: I just feel like I’ve paid my dues in the customer service industry.
I’ve done the song and dance of “you brought in an expired coupon and are being incredibly rude to a minimum wage employee?
I’m here to serve you and whatever hostility you bring with a fucking smile on my face.
Let ME apologize for YOUR rudeness

column4: and therefore a god in my eyes!

column2: and the people (mostly) were pretty cool.
But I just can’t deal anymore.

column3: now I can actually work on my schoolwork.

column2: the only sucky thing about it is I think I’m getting sick because I kissed oscar and he’s super sick.
I wasn’t planning on doing shit this spring break anyway.

column3: that’s just another excuse to do just that.

column2: And now to masturbate and go to sleep!
